activities.name: Informed Consent
activities.description: Obtain written informed consent from participant

activities.name: Informed Consent for optional samples
activities.description: Subject participation in the pharmacogenomics and exploratory biomarker research is optional

activities.name: Assess compliance with single-blind placebo run-in
activities.description: Assess compliance with single-blind placebo run-in

activities.name: Record pre-study serum creatinine
activities.description: The latest 3 pre-study serum creatinine values collected within a year prior to screening

activities.name: Administer/dispense double-blind study drug
activities.description: Study drug is dispensed every 26 weeks after the first year

activities.name: Initial physical examination/Vitals and weight, foot examination
activities.description: Full physical examination including body systems and foot care

activities.name: Follow-Up /Vitals, foot examination
activities.description: Focused physical examination at Week 52 and every 52 weeks thereafter

activities.name: Brief Visit w/vitals, weight, foot examination
activities.description: Brief visit with vital signs and foot examination

activities.name: 12-lead electrocardiogram
activities.description: Electrocardiograms conducted at local investigator site

activities.name: Follicle stimulating hormone
activities.description: Follicle stimulating hormone, if necessary per inclusion criteria

activities.name: First morning void for albumin/creatinine ratio
activities.description: First morning void for albumin/creatinine ratio

activities.name: Archived samples (plasma, serum, and urine samples) for exploratory analysis
Dispense glucose testing supplies and first study diary
activities.description: Dispense glucose testing supplies and first study diary

activities.name: Review/discuss subject diary and SMBG results
activities.description: Review/discuss subject diary and SMBG results

encounters.name: End of Treatment (EOT, EOS or EW)

notes.text: a. EOS = end-of-study; EOT = end-of-treatment; EW=early withdrawal; HbA1c =hemoglobin A1c; CBC = complete blood count; SMBG = self-monitored blood glucose; TC = telephone contact.
b. Subjects who fail protocol-specified screening criteria for study entry may be rescreened at the discretion of the investigator.
c. At Week 39 and at the midpoint between office visits after Week 52, telephone contact will be made to check the subject's status.
d. This visit will occur at Week 52, 104, 156, 208, and 260.
e. This telephone contact will occur at Week 39, 65, 91, 117, 143, 169, 195, 221, 247, and 273.
f. This visit will occur at Week 26, 78, 130, 182, 234 and 286.
g. End-of-treatment/early withdrawal evaluations will be performed when the double-blind treatment phase is ended.
h. A telephone follow-up contact will be conducted for all subjects approximately 30 days (+/- 12 days) after the last dose.
